comments.body: `onSelectionChanged` is a bit misleading. The selection property doesn't change. It's more like `onSelectionChangeRequest` or something like that. It took me a while to understand the ownership model for the selection.

(This is a bit weird. The RenderObject model would be to have the RenderObject own and mutate its own selection rather than having the owner be in charge of how to respond to selection move requests.)

Yeah, the current design doesn't work well.  We probably should move the ownership of the interaction with the keyboard all the way down to the rendering layer.  The widget layer would then just signal that it wanted this render object to interact with the keyboard and get notifications of state changes.
